Source code for autocoop.builder.test1

import unittest
import builder


[docs]class Test_builder(unittest.TestCase):

[docs]    def test_Vtable(self):
        vt = builder.Vtable()
        self.assertTrue(vt.addEntry(1, 123))
        self.assertFalse(vt.addEntry(1, 234))
        self.assertTrue(vt.addEntry(2, 456))

        self.assertEqual(len(vt.getBuffer()), 3*8)



[docs]    def test_Memory(self):
        mem = builder.Memory()
        s0 = 'a'*12
        s1 = 'b'*16
        self.assertTrue(mem.addData(8, s0))
        self.assertFalse(mem.addData(10, s1))
        self.assertTrue(mem.addData(20, s1))



[docs]    def test_Building_0(self):
        b = builder.Builder(0)

        # create and add objects
        VENTRY_0 = 10
        VENTRY_1 = 16
        LABEL_0 = 555

        obj0 = builder.Object(VENTRY_0, 0xDEADBEEF, builder.Arch.X64, noFakeVtable=False)
        obj1 = builder.Object(VENTRY_1, 0xBABECAFE, builder.Arch.X64, noFakeVtable=False)
        b.addObj(obj0)
        b.addObj(obj1)

        # add labeled data such that both objects need to be overlapping.
        obj0.mem.addQword(8, qword=124356, label=LABEL_0)
        obj1.mem.addQword(16, label=LABEL_0)

        b._calcOffsets(32)
        ## 1) check object offsets
        # assert that offset0 - offset1 == 8
        self.assertEqual(b.objOffsets[0] - b.objOffsets[1], 8)
        
        buffMeta = b._createMetaBuffer()
        self.assertEqual(len(buffMeta), (2*8 + (VENTRY_0 + VENTRY_1 + 2)*8))

        buffObj = b._createObjBuffer()
        # assert that the ouput size is not [obj0] + [obj1] but [obj1] as both objects overlap. (obj0 is completely contained in obj1.)
        self.assertEqual(len(buffObj), obj1.mem.getSize() + b.objOffsets[1])

        ## 2) check label offsets
        self.assertEqual(b.lblOffsets[LABEL_0] - b.objOffsets[0], 8)
        self.assertEqual(b.lblOffsets[LABEL_0] - b.objOffsets[1], 16)



[docs]    def test_Building_1(self):
        BASE = 0xDEADBEEF
        LABEL_0 = 555

        b = builder.Builder(BASE)

        # create and add objects
        obj0 = builder.Object()
        obj1 = builder.Object()
        b.addObj(obj0)
        b.addObj(obj1)

        # add labeled data to obj0 and add a pointer to that data to obj1.
        obj0.mem.addQword(8, qword=124356, label=LABEL_0)
        obj1.mem.addUnresolvedPointer(8, targetLabel=LABEL_0, targetOffset=4)

        b._calcOffsets(32)
        buffObj = b._createObjBuffer(builder.Relocator(0, BASE))

        # read out unresolved pointer
        import struct
        ptrOffset = b.objOffsets[1] + 8
        ptr = struct.unpack("<Q", buffObj[ptrOffset:ptrOffset+8])[0]
        self.assertEqual(ptr, BASE + b.objOffsets[0] + 8 + 4)

        

[docs]    def test_Building_2(self):
        BASE = 0

        class LABEL:
            WINEXEC, A, B, CMD = range(4)

        b = builder.Builder(BASE)

        obj = builder.Object(1, 123456)
        obj.mem.addUnresolvedPointer(offset=0x10, targetLabel=LABEL.A, targetOffset=-8)
        b.addObj(obj)

        # create helper objects that serve as data containers
        objA = builder.Object(noFakeVtable=True)
        objA.setVptr(0xDEADBEEF)
        objA.mem.addUnresolvedPointer(offset=8, targetLabel=LABEL.B, targetOffset=-8, label=LABEL.A)
        b.addObj(objA)

        objB = builder.Object(noFakeVtable=True)
        objB.setVptr(0xDEADBEEF)
        objB.mem.addUnresolvedPointer(offset=8, targetLabel=LABEL.CMD, label=LABEL.B)
        objB.mem.addData(offset=0x38, data="calc.exe", label=LABEL.CMD)
        b.addObj(objB)

        import struct
        b._calcOffsets(512)
        buff = b._createObjBuffer()
        obj0Off = b.objOffsets[0]
        
        # get pointer to objA
        pA = struct.unpack("<Q",buff[obj0Off+0x10:obj0Off+0x18])[0]
        # check if we have an vptr placeholder there
        vptrA = struct.unpack("<Q", buff[pA: pA+8])[0]
        self.assertEqual(vptrA, 0xDEADBEEF)

        # get pointer to objB
        pB = struct.unpack("<Q",buff[pA+8:pA+0x10])[0]
        vptrB = struct.unpack("<Q", buff[pB: pB+8])[0]
        self.assertEqual(vptrB, 0xDEADBEEF)
        # get pionter to CMD
        pCmd = struct.unpack("<Q",buff[pB+8:pB+0x10])[0]
        self.assertEqual(buff[pCmd:pCmd+8], "calc.exe")



[docs]    def test_ArrayBuilder(self):

        BASE_BUFFER = 0x1000
        MAX_SIZE = 0x1000

        initObj = builder.Obj64(fixedOffset=0) # we want our initObj to reside at offset 0
        initObj.setVptr(0x2000)
        initObj.mem.addUnresolvedPointer(8, targetLabel=builder.ArrayBuilder.LABEL_ARRAY)
        b = builder.ArrayBuilder(builder.Arch.X64, BASE_BUFFER, initObj)
        
        obj0 = builder.Obj64()
        obj0.setVptr(0x3000)
        b.addObj(obj0)

        obj1 = builder.Obj64()
        obj1.setVptr(0x4000)
        b.addObj(obj1)

        buffer = b.finalize(MAX_SIZE)
        self.assertTrue(len(buffer) >= initObj.mem.getSize() + obj0.mem.getSize() + obj1.mem.getSize() + 2 * 8)

        import struct
        # get pointer to array
        pArray = struct.unpack("<q",buffer[8:16])[0]
        self.assertTrue(pArray > BASE_BUFFER and pArray < (BASE_BUFFER + MAX_SIZE))
        offsetArray = pArray - BASE_BUFFER
        # does the array contain pointer to objects?
        offsetObj0 = struct.unpack("<q", buffer[offsetArray:offsetArray+8])[0] - BASE_BUFFER
        self.assertTrue(long(offsetObj0) == b.objOffsets[1])

        offsetObj1 = struct.unpack("<q", buffer[offsetArray+8:offsetArray+16])[0] - BASE_BUFFER
        self.assertTrue(long(offsetObj1) == b.objOffsets[2])



[docs]    def test_LinkedListBuilder(self):
        BASE_BUFFER = 0x3F00000
        MAX_SIZE = 1024

        initObj = builder.Obj64(fixedOffset=0) # we want our initObj to reside at offset 0
        initObj.setVptr(0x2000)
        initObj.mem.addUnresolvedPointer(offset=8, targetLabel=builder.LinkedListBuilder.LABEL_BASE_LL)
        b = builder.LinkedListBuilder(BASE_BUFFER, 0, 8, initObj, builder.Arch.X64())

        # we create a circular linked list
        obj0 = builder.Obj64()
        obj0.setVptr(0x3000)
        labels0 = b.addObj(obj0)

        obj1 = builder.Obj64()
        obj1.setVptr(0x4000)
        b.addObj(obj1)

        obj2 = builder.Obj64()
        obj2.setVptr(0x5000)
        b.addObj(obj2, labelNextItem=labels0.labelObj)

        buffer = b.finalize(MAX_SIZE)



if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()
